result.execSummary:
The defendant Tera D Snyder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 36 days. TIME SERVED
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Court WAIVES all costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tera D Snyder

defendant.name: Snyder, Tera D
defendant.address: 1624 E St. Francis Ave, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: -filed by Attorney Angel Johnson.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 36 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 36 days TIME SERVED.

THE COURT WAIVES all costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, Defendant Tera D Snyder not in court, in custody.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL  JUSTICE  FACILITY  (CJF)  FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Defendant Tera D Snyder in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Alicia H. Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility (CJF) for purposes of this hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Court reminders.

Defendant Tera D Snyder in court with attorney Arial J. Rosenberg.  Defendant Tera D Snyder in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Austin Mort in court.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL FORFEITED.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's Department Store, 5300 S 76th Street

Defendant Tera D Snyder in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Tera D Snyder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered signature bond previously set to continue.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's Dept. Store at 5300 S. 76th Street

Defendant Tera D Snyder in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Tera D Snyder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tera D Snyder not in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 01-28-2016 at 01:30pm
